replies.bodyText:
Language edit rules are:

only change things in values/ (the English language version`
avoid if at all possible string renames if the use is the same (causes re-translation as it looks like a delete-old/add-new to translators)
I upload things from values to crowdin via tools/manage_crowdin.py with a fancy maintainer key oo la la
translators get to work (or not)
I sync contents of values-NN/ down from crowdin via tools/update-localizations.py and commit that to git

Special care must be taken if translations were deleted, as that would represent an incompatibility with previous native code and is thus considered a breaking change and means translations can't be backported/cherry-picked past the point a translation was deleted (including if the name was changed, as mentioned above)
More thorough than the answer strictly needed but I wanted to info dump on you if for no other reason than to increase bus factor in the area, I'm not sure anyone but Tim and I know how to drive it right now
